resources.description: Citation Information:nOriginator:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernPublication Date:n2012nTitle:nVery Warm Modeled Temperature ChaffeenEdition:nFirstnPublication Information:nPublication Place:nEarth Science & Observation Center, Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Science (CIRES), University of Colorado, BouldernPublisher:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernDescription:nThis layer contains areas of anomalous surface temperature in Chaffee County identified from ASTER thermal data and spatial based insolation model. The temperature is calculated using the Emissivity Normalization Algorithm that separate temperature from emissivity. The incoming solar radiation was calculated using spatial based insolation model developed by Fu and Rich (1999). Then the temperature due to solar radiation was calculated using emissivity derived from ASTER data. The residual temperature, i.e. temperature due to solar radiation subtracted from ASTER temperature was used to identify thermally anomalous areas. Areas that had temperature greater than 2u03c3 were considered ASTER modeled very warm surface exposures (thermal anomalies)nSpatial Domain:nExtent:nTop:n4333432.368072 mnLeft:n366907.700763 mnRight:n452457.816015 mnBottom:n4208271.566715 mnContact Information:nContact Organization:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernContact Person:nKhalid HusseinnAddress:nCIRES, Ekeley BuildingnEarth Science & Observation Center (ESOC)n216 UCBnCity:nBouldernState:nCOnPostal Code:n80309-0216nCountry:nUSAnContact Telephone:n303-492-6782nSpatial Reference Information:nCoordinate System:nUniversal Transverse Mercator (UTM) WGSu20191984 Zone 13NnFalse Easting:n500000.00000000nFalse Northing:n0.00000000nCentral Meridian:n-105.00000000nScale Factor:n0.99960000nLatitude of Origin:n0.00000000nLinear Unit:nMeternDatum:nWorld Geodetic System u20191984 (WGS u20191984)nPrime Meridian:nGreenwichnAngular Unit:nDegreenDigital Form:nFormat Name:nShapefile

title: Areas of Anomalous Surface Temperature in Chaffee County, Colorado, as Identified from ASTER Thermal Data
name: areas-of-anomalous-surface-temperature-in-chaffee-county-colorado-as-identified-from-aster
notes: Citation Information:nOriginator:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernPublication Date:n2012nTitle:nVery Warm Modeled Temperature ChaffeenEdition:nFirstnPublication Information:nPublication Place:nEarth Science & Observation Center, Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Science (CIRES), University of Colorado, BouldernPublisher:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernDescription:nThis layer contains areas of anomalous surface temperature in Chaffee County identified from ASTER thermal data and spatial based insolation model. The temperature is calculated using the Emissivity Normalization Algorithm that separate temperature from emissivity. The incoming solar radiation was calculated using spatial based insolation model developed by Fu and Rich (1999). Then the temperature due to solar radiation was calculated using emissivity derived from ASTER data. The residual temperature, i.e. temperature due to solar radiation subtracted from ASTER temperature was used to identify thermally anomalous areas. Areas that had temperature greater than 2u03c3 were considered ASTER modeled very warm surface exposures (thermal anomalies)nSpatial Domain:nExtent:nTop:n4333432.368072 mnLeft:n366907.700763 mnRight:n452457.816015 mnBottom:n4208271.566715 mnContact Information:nContact Organization:nEarth Science &Observation Center (ESOC), CIRES, University of Colorado at BouldernContact Person:nKhalid HusseinnAddress:nCIRES, Ekeley BuildingnEarth Science & Observation Center (ESOC)n216 UCBnCity:nBouldernState:nCOnPostal Code:n80309-0216nCountry:nUSAnContact Telephone:n303-492-6782nSpatial Reference Information:nCoordinate System:nUniversal Transverse Mercator (UTM) WGSu20191984 Zone 13NnFalse Easting:n500000.00000000nFalse Northing:n0.00000000nCentral Meridian:n-105.00000000nScale Factor:n0.99960000nLatitude of Origin:n0.00000000nLinear Unit:nMeternDatum:nWorld Geodetic System u20191984 (WGS u20191984)nPrime Meridian:nGreenwichnAngular Unit:nDegreenDigital Form:nFormat Name:nShape file
